pros: Awesome place like family learned alot
cons: Short staffed constant need of help

review_title: Horrific experience in the darker side of state funding and non profit companies.
pros: The benefits are great for this type of company. The pay isn't awful and the overtime is decent.
cons: This company is toxic and feels like working in a confusing hellscape. I feel so bad for the clients and residents. Lies, games, abuse are commonplace here. This place is an experience in gas lighting and why people are terrified of placing loved ones in facilities. I have no idea how this company gets away with hiding so much abuse and is able to hire anyone anymore. Upper management sets the toxic scene and employees of all departments scramble to cover shifts and fight each other following into the toxic culture. Don't go down this rabbit hole. You will see and hear things that you can't forget and wished you'd never known. My heart aches for the people who nobody is fighting for or watching over. Trying to help will get you nowhere.

review_title: Flexible schedules, excellent benefifts and fun place to work!
pros: The benefits and flexible schedule enables anyone to work as they will work around your schedule. Great opportunity for someone just entering the medical care field as they provide all of the training at no cost to you! The benefits are excellent and the people are caring, passionate and friendly!
cons: Cannot think of anything! Great place to work!

pros: The peopke there were passionate and driven, and it's truly inspiring to be surrounded by such positive energy. I'm thrilled to be workng with them.
cons: I had the terrible experience of working for a truly horrible employer. The management was terrible, Avoid if you can. It was a stressful and exhausting experience that was also abusive. I would never wish that upon anyone. If you have any other options, take them! You will be so much happier trust me!

pros: I had a few colleagues who were very helpful.
cons: This company relies too much on politics. Nothing here is about meritocracy because everything is about sucking up to your bosses. You have to be a "yes-man" if you want to gain the favor of your managers. And of you don't, you won't get anything from them. Pay raises and promotions happen because of the politics and drama, and this toxic environment attracts only certain kinds of people. If your want a fair and health work atmosphere, this is not the place for you.

job_title: Residential Coordinator in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: Sometimes they have bonuses for picking up shifts
cons: The management is awful and unsupportive. They are neglectful of their clients and treat their workers like they can walk all over them.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Appleton, WI
pros: As a nursing student it offered great experience with flexible float and pool staff hours
cons: Short staffing is commonplace in most programs

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Oshkosh, WI
pros: Pay and working with clients
cons: Poor Communication and poor direction

pros: I was surrounded by good and not-so-great type of people and I learned how to be professionalism in front all of them.
cons: Having connections with the management team was a must if you want your career to move forward and I think that's messed up. Favoritism killed all the transparency and fairness in the game.

job_title: Personal Care Worker in Appleton, WI
pros:
-Great residents
-Supportive coworkers
-Certain members of management really do try their hardest, even though they don't get the support they need
cons:
-Scheduling would frequently leave gaps at the end of my shift until the start of the next while expecting me to stay and cover it. I also had a shift changed last minute and was not made aware of this by the person who changed the schedule
-Management would brush off concerns of staff about resident's safety
-Company as a whole is understaffed, leaving staff to work full shifts by themselves regardless of the fact that certain houses are supposed to have 2+ staff at a time due to certain resident needs/risks

pros: Get to do work that benefits individuals in need. Good team environment.
cons: Office jobs are less demanding but working with the clients can mean longer hours

pros: Loved the people I loved with as in coworkers and members
cons: They are under staffed and need more employees

pros: Consumers in the house are great.
cons: Massive drama and major disrespect from consumers, coworkers and management!

review_title: Scheduling Nightmare, poor Non-profit style business planning
pros: The people you work with are great.  Elderly, disabled, low-income, medium-income, mentally ill, limited mobility, etc.  The tasks are simple/light housework, medication reminders, transportation, grocery shopping, companionship.
cons: First three days of training, the trainer didn't know I was tagging along.  Never trained on medication reminders.  The new scheduling team is untrained, unapproachable, not understanding.  Many times a client canceled and I was never let know until I showed up, knocked on the door, and called scheduling only to find out that the client canceled and I never received a call.  The scheduling team constantly messed up my schedule when I sent out the proper paperwork a month in advanced and contacted the schedulers via email with an availability schedule.  Management didn't like fixing the scheduling issues, they simply would say, "It's a new system and we're working out the kinks."  It was about five months and the "kinks" were no where close to being worked out.  Schedulers often had attitudes with the employees when issues arouse.

pros: The relationships you create with your residents is unlike any other. There are good days and bad days, but with this job you have the ability to do fun and creative outings/activities geared towards the clients interests. It really is a fun job if you make it fun.
cons: Upper management will hire anyone. This brings in a lot of people that are only here for a paycheck. These people are the ones that want to sit on their phones doing nothing while the other employee is breaking the back doing both peoples work.  When they aren't desperate for help, they'll tell you not to take any over time. But when theyre in a pinch and need your help suddenly that doesn't matter. Some employees get overworked while others do the bare minimum.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: The consumers are the best part of this job. Working with them makes you feel like what you're doing really matters.
cons:
The management has no idea what they're doing. Nobody speaks to eachother, things that need to be fixed that can cause a safety hazard go weeks without being taken care of. Maintenence requests are never filled, there are times when there's hardly enough food in the houses to make a meal. The constantly being called to fill shifts. I got a call Every. Single. Day. I was off. Maybe they need to hire more people and treat them better. 
Also, the duration of the shifts. One shift you worked 6 hours, slept at the house 8 hours, then worked 2 hours in the morning. 16 hours altogether and you don't even get to sleep in your own bed. Oh but they pay you? Sorry, $10 an hour for 8 hours and $40 for the whole sleeping? No thanks. Not worth it.

review_title: As a part-time employee and full-time college student, this job was perfect!
job_title: Personal Care Worker in Oshkosh, WI
pros: While the hours aren't your regular 8a-5p, the way they schedule things is very consistent.  The training was extremely thorough as a caregiver and has allowed me to obtain other positions fairly easily due to already having received the PAID TRAINING that Clarity Care provides.  They are also a large enough company that it would be fairly easy to move into new roles if you were to tire of the role you were hired for.
cons: The type of work here can be very draining.  It is also extremely rewarding, but if you aren't cut out for it you won't last very long.  You have to be very resilient and be able to think on your feet.  It takes a lot of compassion and patience.

job_title: Community Employee Support Provider in Oshkosh, WI
pros: They are flexible and want to work around your schedule. Pays a lot more then starting out at department store or fast food. They promote within which is a good sign.
cons: The raises take a while to get. you only get your schedule a week in advance, which is fine if you don't have a tight schedule, and want to plan something.

pros: Making a difference in under-served communities, opportunities to learn new skills, flexible, family-first environment, supportive human resources team, responsive payroll team, accounting team with integrity that is open to creative problem solving, excellent and affordable benefits
cons: Compensation is going to be lower than in comparable positions in administration because this is a non-profit. Worth it for me; I have worked in the for-profit sector, and it was soul-killing. Work is hard and stressful at times, but I have never felt more motivated in a position. Excellent benefits must be considered alongside lower compensation rates.

review_title: Overworked and underpaid. No one has a life anymore if they decide to work for Clarity Care
pros: Great training program and learning experience. Decent benefits. A good starter job for those thinking about going to school for nursing or as a CNA. And of course the clients you work with.
cons:
When I started the program, my starting rate was around $8/hour. Now the starting rate is around $10/hour. And the reason is because there are lots, and I mean LOTS of open positions eveywhere and no one to cover them! 

They've recently opened up a ton of more houses, yet nobody to cover them. Clarity Care is desperate for the help. Every CC Residential house is short on staffing, so don't be surprised if you are working lots of overtime. You can't be forced to work the overtime, however if nobody will pick up the overtime, then the coordinator of the house must cover. The coordinators have a life outside of work too and have put a lot of effort into the house they run more than any DSP that works under them. CUT THEM SOME SLACK,  THEY DON'T HAVE IT EASY!  THAT'S WHY THEY WERE HIRED FOR THAT POSTION IN THE FIRST PLACE!!!! I've known coordinators/managers that have worked 90+ hour weeks. Ridiculous! This is why many employees quit and there are a crap ton of openings, they can't handle the overtime.

If you are applying for a DSP position at Clarity Care (October 2015), you're guaranteed to be hired. CC will pretty much hire anyone off the street.

pros: The houses are wonderful to work in, and I had a wonderful team of staff. The benefits are pretty good, they had a lot to offer that many companies don't.
cons: Being on call 24/7 sucked. And if I wanted to have a life I had to make sure the hours were filled myself, because scheduling just doesn't help. Claritycare also tends to take good people and burn them out.

pros: The company creates a very positive culture; making it easy for employees to want to come to work.   People who work here can feel good about making a positive impact on the community and individuals we serve.  The team and management is very supportive.  Employees earn PTO their first full month.
cons: The job can be difficult depending on the day and the client we serve.  Also, the deductible for the health insurance is quite high.

review_title: Helping clients with different aspects of their jobs.
job_title: Job Coach in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: Mileage reimbursement. Get paid from the time you leave your house until you get home. They work with you with hours and where you would rather work.
cons: They don't give people chances when it comes to promotions. HR never returns emails and it takes them almost a week to get a hold of you.

pros: The clients made me smile everyday.
cons: They say you will have a set schedule Mon.-Fri., 40 hours a week. This is not the case and you will be working weekend, nights, evenings, etc. You are on call constantly and will have no life out of work. It is not worth the pay when you work your life away. You do not get a lot of on the job training from management and they are not appreciated.

pros: Their are no pros except the relationships you bond with the clients.
cons: Management.. Pay.. Overworked.. Not appreciated.. Used just as a body to be there as a den mother..

pros: Some of the best reasons to work for Clarity Care are that you get to work with amazing people, your coworkers are the best you could ever have. They care about you and your family and they make you feel like your apart of a team. There is plenty of room for growth within the company.
cons: There isn't any cons as long as you do your job correctly.

pros: Wonderful opportunity to help people in your own community. They have many different job opportunities that will fit with different people's needs and interests. Great benefits and a great team environment. Rapidly growing company with many opportunities for advancement.
cons: Same struggle as most in the industry of trying to keep up with hiring for the growth.

pros: Focused on serving the needs of their clients and employees.  Always looking to make improvements and develop new leaders within the company.  Looks to remain competitive with wage and benefit offerings in the caregiving field, even as a non-profit.
cons: You get a bad-apple coworker every now and then that tries to drag you down with them.  Other than that, none!

pros: You make lots of new friends. Good pay. Great benefits you can sign up for once you start. Your coworkers become family. The residents are great. Everyone is so nice and caring. PTO. Sign on bonuses. Everything about working here is great I love it.
cons: There is definitely no Cons

job_title: Direct Service Provider II in Oshkosh, WI
pros: Great consumers and co-workers
cons: Overworked and underpaid, long hours, short staffed, must kiss butt in order to get a promotion, raises are practically non-existent.

review_title: Fun and Fullfilling Place to Work
pros: Great Mission - knowing you are making a difference, room for advancement, great co-workers, good benefits
cons: Can be stressful at times

review_title: I enjoy working for Clarity Care.
job_title: Direct Support Provider in Green Bay, WI
pros: Flexible with hours if you need night shifts, day shifts, or weekends.
cons: Some physical work involved, but also down time.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Oconto, WI
pros: I enjoyed the clients I took care of
cons: Communication was horrible,  no one knew what was going on

job_title: Direct Service Provider in Appleton, WI
pros: Some of the staff genuinely care
cons: The people who care are beaten down and broken by higher ups who are in the business of taking advantage of the most vulnerable group of people.

job_title: Scheduling and Customer Service Manager in Green Bay, WI
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: Worst company I've ever worked for or dealt with.  The level of incompetence and intentional negligence is astounding.  Low pay, abusive administration, and overworked employees makes this one of the worst employers around.

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant in Green Bay, WI
pros: Satisfaction in helping your clients...
cons: Not much support from management...

job_title: Direct Support Provider in Green Bay, WI
pros: pay, hours, pay, hours, pay
cons: workers and management are hard to work for
